result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew A Rausch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
No contact with victim until the defendant has completed at least 2 batterer's intervention classes, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.

Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
Agent is to verify paternity of children, and that support is being paid.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes:

**11-03-15, Order for Commitment Time for Non-compliance with Probation Conditions. Defendant to serve 15 days STRAIGHT TIME, with no good time credit, nunc pro tunc to 10-26-15.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew A Rausch

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Condtions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed (15 days straight time), nunc pro tunc to 10/26/15.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 5 months in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 15 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim until the defendant has completed at least 2 batterer's intervention classes, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Agent is to verify paternity of children, and that support is being paid.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Matthew A Rausch in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Matthew A Rausch in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for plea.  Defense would like a little more time.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew A Rausch in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Matthew A Rausch in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Matthew A Rausch in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
